p: Although alpha-synuclein deposition has become a recent target of PD drug development, [ 50] PD patients with the most common inherited forms, those with mutations in Parkin ( PRKN) or leucine rich-repeat kinase 2 ( LRRK2), sometimes lack such alpha-synuclein aggregates. [ 51, 52] In addition, a large proportion of individuals possessing alpha-synuclein deposits do not exhibit clinical symptoms of PD or other dementia related disorders. [ 53] In light of the strong overlap of PD-related genes with mitochondrial function, including alpha-synuclein itself, [ 17] such discrepancies have led to a hypothesis that mitochondrial dysfunction plays a role in the disease's etiology.
